requirement: Requirement 1: Install and maintain a firewall configuration to protect cardholder data.
title: Install and maintain a firewall configuration
description: Ensure that a firewall configuration is installed and maintained to protect cardholder data.
testing_procedures: Verify that firewall and router configurations are documented and approved.
Check that all changes to the firewall and router configurations are documented and verified.
Ensure that a DMZ environment is included in the network design.
remediation:
Implement and maintain a firewall configuration to protect cardholder data.
Document and approve firewall and router configurations.
Implement a DMZ environment in the network design.
Use the YaST firewall module to define complex rules and integrate the local system firewall.

requirement: Identify, document, and justify all services and protocols running on a system. Evaluate the security impact of insecure services or protocols.
title: Identify insecure services, protocols, and ports
description: Identify insecure services, protocols, and ports allowed; and verify that security features are documented for each service.
testing_procedures: Review documentation for all services and protocols running on the system.
Verify that insecure services or protocols are evaluated for security impact.
Check that unnecessary services or protocols are disabled or removed.
remediation:
Identify and document all services and protocols, and evaluate their security impact.
Document all services and protocols running on the system.
Evaluate the security impact of each service or protocol.
Disable or remove services or protocols that are not necessary for business operations.

requirement: Create rules for allowed outbound traffic and define source addresses for services.
title: Limit Inbound and Outbound Traffic
description: Verify that inbound and outbound traffic is limited to that which is necessary for the cardholder data environment.
testing_procedures: Review firewall rules to ensure only necessary traffic is allowed.
Verify outbound traffic rules are defined and enforced.
remediation:
Restrict traffic to necessary sources and destinations.
Define and implement firewall rules for necessary traffic.
Ensure SSH daemon is only reachable on a separate administration interface.

requirement: Deny all outbound and inbound traffic for which no exceptions are defined.
title: Deny All Other Inbound and Outbound Traffic
description: Verify that all other inbound and outbound traffic is specifically denied.
testing_procedures: Check firewall rules to ensure all non-essential traffic is denied.
Verify that forwarding is disabled for endpoint servers.
remediation:
Implement rules to deny all non-essential traffic.
Add firewall rules to block all non-essential traffic.
Ensure forwarding is disabled by kernel parameters.

requirement: Use iptables rules and Linux kernel reverse path filtering to prevent IP spoofing.
title: Implement Anti-Spoofing Measures
description: Implement anti-spoofing measures to detect and block forged source IP addresses from entering the network.
testing_procedures: Verify iptables rules are in place to allow only input from certain addresses.
Check if reverse path filtering is enabled.
remediation:
Configure anti-spoofing measures using iptables and reverse path filtering.
Define iptables rules to restrict input to specified addresses.
Ensure reverse path filtering is enabled by checking /proc/sys/net/ipv4/conf/all/rp_filter.
